channel.title: EdgevillePK - The Fight Awaits | Unique Content, Flawless Combat, Follow us Toda
channel.description:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/TAz9nax.png[/img]
[size=12pt] [font=trebuchet ms][url=http://edgevillepk.com]Homepage[/url] | [url=http://edgevillepk.com/forums/]Community[/url][/center]
[center] ------------------------------ [size=12pt][font=verdana]What is EdgevillePK?[/size] ------------------------------ [/center] EdgevillePK is going to be a Spawn/PK server in it's early days before opening up an Economy world, this server is currently still in development and is being developed by a highly skilled, highly experienced team. The team alone have over 17 years Java experience between them, and between the website developers there is 16 years in total. This is what sets us apart from your average, run of the mill server. We've been around since the start, and we'll be around until the end. All of us having been in the RSPS scene for a number of years, we've seen the same type of people come and go. Children with little knowledge around anything coming in and ripping off people, then going when they get bored and leaving people hanging. If you're looking for professionalism and stability, you've visited the right thread.
[center]---------------------- [size=12pt][font=verdana]Meet the team![/size] ---------------------- Stuart - Java Developer of 6 years. Karma - Java Developer of 4 years. Jesse - Java Developer of 7 years. Ruby - Website Developer of 7 years. Lunacy - Website Developer of 9 years. TheeRash - Graphics Designer of 6 years. [/center]
[center] ------------------------------ [size=12pt][font=verdana]What are your plans?[/size] ------------------------------ [/center] In short: we plan to be the absolute number one server-family in the world. Starting with our PK/Spawn server we're looking to build up a continual player-base of between 30-50 players. Once we get the desired amount, we're going to do a major overhaul of our website and game to the players needs. Once we remodel ourselves in the image of the average player, we are then looking at opening our second world as an Economy server. This is going to be achieved by a serious amount of advertisement and marketing on our part. What guarantees us the players, you say? One of our team members owns a marketing company & a website development company. If you put both of these together, at our disposal are SEO experts and advertisement and marketing specialists. All the while still growing, we will be ever updating our worlds and website to keep up with current trends in the player-base. A truly player-based, dependable, sustainable server is what this scene needs. We can deliver that. With our experience in the RSPS world, one of our team members also hosted a server that set the pace for an ever growing Soul Split back in 2011-2012, reaching the likes of 900 players online at weekends.
[center] -------------------------- [size=12pt][font=verdana]Development Blogs[/size] --------------------------[/center] Server Developments: [code]Removed Graham's Task System Improved the way the main thread is created Removed the redundant Client Class Removed the redundant PlayerAssistant Class Added server sided cache loading, just need to update the parsing so that the new data is loaded into the server Complete implementation of our current list of burncards, aside from adding the custom items. Tons of Client additions including:
[ul][*]Fullscreen and Resizeable added, supports the loginscreen too. [*]Resizeable chatbox in Fullscreen and Resizeable mode [*]Camera Gliding [*]HD Ground Textures and MipMapping [*]HD Minimap [*]Private Chat Color Changing (Includes a timestamp) [*]Settings system to save and load client sided information that I decide to assign it to store [*]Tweening[/ul] [/code]
Website Developments: [code] Search current RSPS for the template trend in the market - COMPLETE Create a web template themed around a medieval game - COMPLETE Get a set of forums online - COMPLETE Create a forum theme from our website design for flow - IN DEVELOPMENT Create an integration class to easily integrate the forums throughout the website - COMPLETE Use said class to create a "portal" type home-page, that updates dynamically - COMPLETE Create a moderation panel where our staff can carry out their duties from the website - IN DEVELOPMENT Make all reports in-game write to the website for moderators who are unable to log in - INCOMPLETE Along with a report centre on the website for moderators to review - COMPLETE Create a system for voting for the game - COMPLETE Create a system for supporting the server, using a CS:GO case/FIFA Pack style idea - IN DEVELOPMENT Create a highscores system for PK players to compete against - COMPLETE Have top voters/supporters/pkers all written to the homepage to give players recognition - INCOMPLETE And lots lots more that will be listed once the current goals are achieved. [/code]
[center] ------------ [size=12pt][font=verdana]Media[/size] ------------
[img]http://i.imgur.com/N3wdhyC.png[/img] [img]http://imgur.com/DVnX00X.gif[/img]
[/center]

item.title: EdgevillePK - The Fight Awaits | Unique Content, Flawless Combat, Follow us Toda
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[center]

[font=trebuchet ms][size=14pt]Update Pack #1 Released!

Date: 22nd January 2016[/size].[/font]

[/center]
[hr]

[font=trebuchet ms][size=12pt]So I’ll just go a little into what these “update packs” are and what they allow the developers to do along with the players. During the week, we will be releasing any hotfixes or bugs in the game and website, however we’re not going to be releasing any new content or areas of the website. Every Friday, starting from the 22nd of January, there will be an “update pack” released, just in time for the weekend! What this allows the developers to do is plan their week, we know what we have to complete by that Friday and we know what time we have available, this removes any doubt in any new members in our community that we will have those updates out like clockwork on the Friday. The issue with a lot of servers these days is that they don’t keep to a schedule and they often make promises they can’t keep. With EdgevillePK we’re different, we like to set the industry standard for how tasks should be completed and how communities should be managed, stay tuned for more of ideas with a similar structure to them.

[hr]
[center][size=12pt]Our next update pack, Friday 29th of January is going to be our game launch, keep the date free![/center]
[hr]

[center][size=14pt]So, this week in review![/size]
[size=10pt]What’s actually happened?[/size][/center]

[ul][li]We’ve stated our launch date as next Friday![/li]
[li]We’ve reorganised our team, removing the dead weight and keeping the people who were working.[/li]
[li]The developers of the game and site have ran several hours of calls to decide almost everything, the game roadmap will be set in place before our 2nd February update pack.[/li]
[li]With our website, we’ve found and released the first draught of the site.[/li]
[li]The homepage now loads any announcements made dynamically from the forum boards.[/li]
[li]The homepage also retrieves any new threads made to the homepage with a limit of the latest 7.[/li]
[li]I’ve made a lot of headway in our vote system, report center and moderator control panel, all three will be complete for the next update pack.[/li]
[li]Cory (Lunacy/RevengePK) has finished up our first draught of the forums theme! This looks amazing.[/li]
[li]Cory has also worked tirelessly on styling our pages as well, pushing for the release of the three systems I listed above for our next update pack.[/li]
[li]Game sided, Stuart has finished our log in screen & numerous client bugs that would take me about a week to list.[/li]
[li]The use of Combat Cards and Combat Packs have been included into our game, written by Jesse. This is a super cool concept that I know you’ll all appreciate![/li]
[li]The PK skill and use of the prestige system has been implemented, once again by Jesse.[/li]
[li]We’ve also had numerous hotfixes and bug fixes here there and everywhere, we’ll be updating the forum with a more in-depth look at this.[/li]
[li]We’ve started to grow a small community over at the forums who are anticipating the release, join them for exclusive peaks at the server![/li][/ul]

[hr]
[center][size=12pt]Update Media[/size][/center]
[hr]

[center]Hyper-realistic fog, dare you enter the wilderness?

3JThknD.png1366×768

Who would’ve guessed our home would’ve been elsewhere?
Now populated!

KedjqBI.png1366×768

Our homepage is looking very slick!

K2Dv1L5.png1279×610

Our dynamically loading announcements are also looking… slick.

NjtQhQ8.png784×354

And the main event, the new forum theme written by Cory!

nIPrW4H.png1210×587
[/center]

[hr]

All in all, we’re looking pretty sweet, eh? If you’d like to see more of our game server and experience our website first hand, check out our Website for more information and sneak peaks at development!

I’m sure you’re all as excited as I am.

Ruby

Read full topic

Yeah I can see that, it does look a little similar. I reckon we might just scrap the hover in the middle and use it as a solid navbar with a logo above it then. Knowing me and Cory we’ll redesign it about 40 times before we’re even near happy with it lol.

[quote=“my-swagger, post:7, topic:554483”]Hope to see some good development. Nice team you have.
I really like the website design. Would be nice for some ingame pictures.[/quote]

Thanks for the recognition :). We’ll have some in-game pictures posted shortly, we’re just pushing for to get the game itself online shortly so I’ll make sure we get some posted in here!

The forums theme itself is in development on the same style as the homepage, but it looks absolutely amazing so far. Here’s a sneakpeak for everyone:

caed776da0549f09e0853c9e01bbac2f.png1244×297

item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Soulcist:

I’ve been having a bit of a craving to do some PVP so I think this’ll be worth it.

Awesome it’ll be good to have you with us!

So today I’ve finished up quite a bit more of the website behind the scenes, the moderator panel is almost ready to be put into action. As is the report centre, it just needs styled which Cory will do as soon as he finishes the theme for the forums which may be finished by tonight, even.

Things are looking like we’re on track to open up very shortly, stay tuned!

item.title: EdgevillePK - The Fight Awaits | Unique Content, Flawless Combat, Follow us Toda
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[center]

[size=12pt] [font=trebuchet ms]Homepage | Community[/center]

[center]

[size=12pt][font=verdana]What is EdgevillePK?[/size]

[/center]
EdgevillePK is going to be a Spawn/PK server in it’s early days before opening up an Economy world, this server is currently still in development and is being developed by a highly skilled, highly experienced team. The team alone have over 17 years Java experience between them, and between the website developers there is 16 years in total. This is what sets us apart from your average, run of the mill server. We’ve been around since the start, and we’ll be around until the end. All of us having been in the RSPS scene for a number of years, we’ve seen the same type of people come and go. Children with little knowledge around anything coming in and ripping off people, then going when they get bored and leaving people hanging. If you’re looking for professionalism and stability, you’ve visited the right thread.

[center]----------------------
[size=12pt][font=verdana]Meet the team![/size]

Stuart - Java Developer of 6 years.
Karma - Java Developer of 4 years.
Jesse - Java Developer of 7 years.
Ruby - Website Developer of 7 years.
Lunacy - Website Developer of 9 years.
TheeRash - Graphics Designer of 6 years.
[/center]

[center]

[size=12pt][font=verdana]What are your plans?[/size]

[/center]
In short: we plan to be the absolute number one server-family in the world. Starting with our PK/Spawn server we’re looking to build up a continual player-base of between 30-50 players. Once we get the desired amount, we’re going to do a major overhaul of our website and game to the players needs. Once we remodel ourselves in the image of the average player, we are then looking at opening our second world as an Economy server. This is going to be achieved by a serious amount of advertisement and marketing on our part. What guarantees us the players, you say? One of our team members owns a marketing company & a website development company. If you put both of these together, at our disposal are SEO experts and advertisement and marketing specialists. All the while still growing, we will be ever updating our worlds and website to keep up with current trends in the player-base. A truly player-based, dependable, sustainable server is what this scene needs. We can deliver that. With our experience in the RSPS world, one of our team members also hosted a server that set the pace for an ever growing Soul Split back in 2011-2012, reaching the likes of 900 players online at weekends.

[center]

[size=12pt][font=verdana]Development Blogs[/size]
--------------------------[/center]
Server Developments:

[code]Removed Graham’s Task System
Improved the way the main thread is created
Removed the redundant Client Class
Removed the redundant PlayerAssistant Class
Added server sided cache loading, just need to update the parsing so that the new data is loaded into the server
Complete implementation of our current list of burncards, aside from adding the custom items.
Tons of Client additions including:

[ul][]Fullscreen and Resizeable added, supports the loginscreen too.
[]Resizeable chatbox in Fullscreen and Resizeable mode
[]Camera Gliding
[]HD Ground Textures and MipMapping
[]HD Minimap
[]Private Chat Color Changing (Includes a timestamp)
[]Settings system to save and load client sided information that I decide to assign it to store
[]Tweening[/ul]
[/code]

Website Developments:

Search current RSPS for the template trend in the market - COMPLETE
Create a web template themed around a medieval game - COMPLETE
Get a set of forums online - COMPLETE
Create a forum theme from our website design for flow - IN DEVELOPMENT
Create an integration class to easily integrate the forums throughout the website - COMPLETE
Use said class to create a "portal" type home-page, that updates dynamically - COMPLETE
Create a moderation panel where our staff can carry out their duties from the website - IN DEVELOPMENT
Make all reports in-game write to the website for moderators who are unable to log in - INCOMPLETE
Along with a report centre on the website for moderators to review - COMPLETE
Create a system for voting for the game - COMPLETE
Create a system for supporting the server, using a CS:GO case/FIFA Pack style idea - IN DEVELOPMENT
Create a highscores system for PK players to compete against - COMPLETE
Have top voters/supporters/pkers all written to the homepage to give players recognition - INCOMPLETE
And lots lots more that will be listed once the current goals are achieved.

[center]

[size=12pt][font=verdana]Media[/size]


DVnX00X.gif761×526

[/center]
